Questions.QuestionString: Which is the primary indication for landing gear system (level 1)
To continue the sequence to retract the landing gear, the LGCIU needs ( level 1)
Answers: A signal the doors fully open position from the doors proximity detectors.
A signal the gears fully open position from the gears proximity detectors.
A signal from the doors proximity detectors.

Questions.QuestionString: When a Landing Gear Control and Interface Unit (LGCIU) detects any shock absorber not extended: ( level 1)
Answers: The control lever is locked in the "DOWN" position.
The control lever is locked in the "DOWN" position by hydraulic.
The control lever is locked in any position.

Questions.QuestionString: What are main braking modes: (level 2)
Answers: Auto brake, alternate brake and parking brake
Normal brake, alternate brake, in FLT brake and parking brake
Normal and alternate brake and in FLT brake

Questions.QuestionString: Which is supplied to the computer for braking and anti-skid computation: (level 2)
Answers: Wheels rotation speed and ADIRU data

Questions.QuestionString: Which send the digital signals of temperature to ECAM display unit: (level 2)
Answers: The Braking and Steering Control Unit (BSCU).
The Landing Gear Control and Interface Unit (LGCIU).

Questions.QuestionString: In enhance system, what controls the antiskid function: (level 1)
Does the steering system remains when the gear extend by gravity: (level 1)
Answers: No if a/c equips enhance system
Yes if a/c equips classic system
Yes if a/c equips enhance system

Questions.QuestionString: The nose wheel steering classic system is: ( level 1)
Answers: Electrically controlled and powered by the green hydraulic system.
Electrically controlled and powered by the yellow hydraulic system.
Electrically controlled and powered may be by mechanical system.

Questions.QuestionString: On the LANDING GEAR PANEL a green triangle light indicates: (level 1)
Answers: The related gear is not locked down.
The related door gear is locked down.
The related gear is locked down.

Questions.QuestionString: When the parking brake handle is pulled and turned to the "ON" position: (level 2)
Answers: The yellow pressure is immediately applied to the brakes.
The yellow pressure is applied to the brakes after 5 minutes.
The parking pressure only applied when the yellow pressure is available.

Questions.QuestionString: Can you retract the landing gear when aircraft on ground: ( level 1)
Answers: No, an interlock mechanism prevents when any shock absorber is not extended.
Yes, when any shock absorber is not extended.

Questions.QuestionString: Which cuts landing gear hydraulic supply in free fall extension: ( level 1)
Rotation of the free fall extension handle closes the cut out valve and: (level 1)
Answers: Open two vent valve to let hydraulic back to the return line.

Questions.QuestionString: What is the normal retraction sequence? (level 2)
Answers: Door open, gear up, door close, cancel gear up signal.
Door open, gear up, door close, maintain gear up signal.
Door open, gear up, door close, cancel door close signal.

Questions.QuestionString: How is inflight braking initiated? ( level 1)
Answers: By setting the landing lever to the UP position.

Questions.QuestionString: When does the UNLK light come on? (level 1)
Answers: When the gear and the related doors are not locked up.
When the gear is not locked down.

Questions.QuestionString: When does the BSCU provide anti-skid control? (level 1)
What is the purpose of the hydraulic fuses? ( level 1)
Answers: To shut off the return lines

Questions.QuestionString: Which hydraulic system powers normal braking? (level 1)
What are the auto brake arming condition? ( level 3)
Answers: An AUTO BRK pushbutton pressed in, green pressure and anti-skid powered and no failure in normal braking system.
An AUTO BRK pushbutton pressed in, yellow pressure and anti-skid powered and no failure in normal braking system.
An AUTO BRK pushbutton pressed in, green pressure and anti-skid deactivated and no failure in normal braking system.

Questions.QuestionString: When does the automatic changeover of the LGCIUs in control occur? ( level 3)
Before the landing gear can be retracted, what must the LGCIU detect? (level 3)
Can you operate the "nose wheel steering” during take off and landing when the speed above 130 kts? ( level 3)
Answers: It is possible through rudder pedals
It is possible through hand wheels

Questions.QuestionString: When is the anti-skid function inhibited by the BSCU? ( level 3)
Answers: When the auto brake system has failed.

Questions.QuestionString: Which component gives priority to the green hydraulic system during classic system? ( level 2)
There are two triangles for each gear on the ECAM WHEEL page. What do they represent? ( level 3)
Answers: Each triangle represents one wheel on the gear.
Each triangle represents the position detected by one of the two LGCIUs.
Each triangle represents one of the braking systems available for that gear.

Questions.QuestionString: What does each turn of the gravity gear extension handle do? ( level 3)
Answers: Open gear doors, unlock gear, drop gear.
Shutoff hydraulic pressure, open doors, unlock gear.
Open gear doors, shutoffs hydraulics, unlock gear, drop gear.

Questions.QuestionString: For A320 when the landing gear is gravity extended, will nose wheel steering be available? ( level 3)
Answers: Yes, if the A/SKID & N/W STRG switch is selected ON.
Limited nose wheel steering is available only through the captain's rudder pedals.

Questions.QuestionString: What happens to the other brake modes when parking brakes are applied (classical version)? ( level 3)
Answers: All other braking modes and anti-skid are deactivated.

Questions.QuestionString: What computer controls the Anti-Skid function on the classical and enhanced aircraft? (level 2)
If the brake system automatically transitions to alternate brakes with the A/Skid & N/W strg switch in the ON position, which of the following will be available? (level 2)
The function of the MLG’s torque links damper is: (level 1)
Answers: To damp side load to the shock absorber.
To increase the landing gear steering angle.
To damp the landing vertical load.

Questions.QuestionString: The BRK fan pushbutton can be used to operate the fans: (level 1)
Answers: To cool all the brakes at same time.
To cool the highest temperature brake only.
To cool 2 brakes on one gear that has highest temperature brake.

Questions.QuestionString: LGCIU system 1 and 2 changeover occurs when: (level 1)
Answers: Setting the landing gear control lever to DOWN.
Setting the landing gear control lever to UP.
After each flight at engine start.

Questions.QuestionString: After take-off, the nose wheels are automatically centered by means of: (level 1)
When does LGCIU turn from standby to active control? (level 1)
Answers: LGCIU control lever is removed away from DOWN position.
LGCIU control lever is removed away from UP position.

Questions.QuestionString: What happen if aircraft on ground Landing gear control lever to be moved to UP position? ( level 3)
Answers: Landing gears do not retract due to installation of safety pin in each landing gear.
Landing gear control lever cannot be moved to UP position due to baulk interlock mechanism.

Questions.QuestionString: What is the function of the Triple Pressure indicator? ( level 3)
Answers: Indicates accumulator pressure and L/H + R/H gear parking brake pressure.
Indicates accumulator pressure and L/H + R/H gear alternate brake pressure.

Questions.QuestionString: What are differences between nose landing gear steering system of Classic and Enhance aircraft? ( level 3)
Answers: Classic steering system is powered by Yellow hydraulic system.
Enhance steering system is powered by Green hydraulic system.
After landing gear free fall extension for classic version, nose gear steering system is lost.

Questions.QuestionString: Before towing aircraft what safety features must be followed? (level 2)
Answers: Check message: “NOSE WHEEL STEER DISC” appears on upper ECAM.
Check the extension of nose gear shock absorber (dimension H) must be less than 300mm.

Questions.QuestionString: How many turns need to be turned the landing gear free fall handle to complete landing gear free fall extension? ( level 3)
What is the function of the torque links mechanism of the main landing gear? (level 2)
Answers: Permit inner cylinder (sliding tube) rotate around outer cylinder (main fitting).
Permit inner cylinder (sliding tube) slide up and down inside the outer cylinder (main fitting).

Questions.QuestionString: What statement is most correct about the Anti-skid system? ( level 3)
Answers: If all ADIRU data is not valid, the reference speed is equal to the maximum of either main landing gear wheel speed.
If all ADIRU data is not valid, the anti-skid function is lost due to no reference speed.

Questions.QuestionString: What happen if rudder pedal disconnect pushbutton is pressed? (level 1)
Answers: Nose wheel steering is disconnected from pedal.

Questions.QuestionString: How to center the nose landing gear during retraction/extension sequence? (level 1)
What is the brake accumulator pressure when the yellow system is pressurized to 3000 psi? (level 2)
What happen if temperature of any brake is reached the threshold? ( level 3)
Answers: Brake Fan pushbutton ON line comes on, the FAN automatically run to cool the brake.
Brake Fan pushbutton ON line comes on, the FAN manually turn on to cool the brake.

Questions.QuestionString: Under normal condition, which hydraulic system is used to extend/retract the aircraft landing gears: (level 1)
Which computer controls the aircraft landing gear extension/retraction cycles: (level 1)
Which computer controls the aircraft braking and steering system: (level 1)
When will the LGCIU switch over automatically to the another LGCIU to control the landing gear extension/retraction: (level 1)
Answers: when landing gear control lever is set to down
when landing gear control lever is set to up

Questions.QuestionString: Which computer gives the indication on the landing gear indicator panel: ( level 3)
When is the cut-out valve closed: ( level 3)
Answers: as soon as the air speed is greater than 260Kts
as soon as the control lever is moved to UP

Questions.QuestionString: In the classic braking system, how is the alternate braking pressure controlled: (level 2)
Answers: by the auxiliary low pressure system

Questions.QuestionString: In the classic braking system, in case of the normal braking system low pressure, how does the alternate braking system pressure take over: (level 3)
Answers: as soon as the braking pedals are pressed in

Questions.QuestionString: The anti-skid function is obtained by: (level 1)
Which component(s) does the gravity extension crank handle operate: ( level 3)
Answers: the cut-out and the safety valves
the cut-out and the vent valves
the safety and the vent valves

Questions.QuestionString: Which computer(s) sends the landing gear position indication to ECAM display ( level 3)
When will the "LGCIU" change-over for landing gear control takes place (level 2)
Answers: When the landing gear control lever is set to down
When the landing gear control lever is set to up

Questions.QuestionString: What controls the landing gear operating sequence? (level 2)
When airborn, NLG will be centered by? (level 1)
Which hydraulic systems are used for the aircraft braking system: (level 2)
Answers: GREEN(for the normal braking) and BLUE(for the alternate braking)
GREEN(for the normal braking) and YELLOW(for the alternate braking)
BLUE(for the normal braking) and YELLOW(for the alternate braking)

Questions.QuestionString: THE GEAR AND DOORS ARE ELECTRICALLY CONTROLLED AND: (level 2)
Answers: Hydraulically operated by the green or yellow hydraulic system.
Hydraulically operated by the green hydraulic system.
Hydraulically operated by the blue hydraulic system.

Questions.QuestionString: THE TRIPLE INDICATOR DISPLAYS: (level 2)
Answers: The green pressure and the normal braking pressure delivered to the LH and RH brakes.
The green brake accumulator and the normal pressure delivered to the LH and RH brakes.
The yellow brake accumulator and the braking pressure delivered to the LH and RH brakes.

Questions.QuestionString: WHEN THE PARKING BRAKE HANDLE IS PULLED AND TURNED TO THE "ON" POSITION: (level 2)
Answers: The green pressure is applied to the brakes.
Only the yellow accumulator pressure is applied to the brakes.
The yellow pressure is applied to the brakes.

Questions.QuestionString: CAN YOU RETRACT THE LANDING GEAR WHEN AIRCRAFT ON GROUND: (level 2)
Answers: No, because of an interlock mechanism
Yes, when any shock absorber is compressed.

Questions.QuestionString: THE STEERING SYSTEM DEACTIVATION FOR TOWING PURPOSE IS ALLOWED BY: (level 2)
Answers: A lever on the towing electrical box located on the MLG.
B. A lever on the towing electrical box located on the NLG.
C. A “towing switch” on the overhead panel .

Questions.QuestionString: THE NOSE WHEEL STEERING SYSTEM IS (Classic Aircraft): (level 2)
Answers: Green hydraulically powered and electrical controlled by the BSCU.
B. Electrically powered and controlled by the BSCU.
C. Hydraulically powered and mechanical controlled by the hand wheel.

Questions.QuestionString: THE PARKING BRAKE SYSTEM IS HYDRAULICALLY SUPPLIED BY: (level 2)
THE GREEN PRESSURE SUPPLIES THE NORMAL BRAKES THROUGH (Classic): (level 2)
Answers: The automatic selector and normal servo valves.
The dual valves and normal servo valves.

Questions.QuestionString: THE NORMAL BRAKE PRESSURE HAS INDICATION: (level 2)
THE PURPOSE OF THE SPARE SEAL ACTIVATING VALVE IS TO: (level 2)
Answers: Isolate the bottom gland seals if a leak occurs.
B. Open the bottom gland seals if a leak occurs.
C. Isolate the shock absorber lower chamber.

Questions.QuestionString: When will the "LGCIU" change-over for landing gear control takes place (Level 2)
Answers: When the landing gear control lever is set to down
When the landing gear control lever is set to up

Questions.QuestionString: When airborn, NLG will be centered by? (Level 2)
Before the LDG can be retracted, the LGCIU must detect that : (Level 2)
When is the hydraulic circuit depressurized after retraction? (Level 2)
Answers: As soon as the selector lever is move to neutral.
As soon as the airspeed is greater than 260 ± 5 Kts
As soon as the last door is closed

Questions.QuestionString: Which system sends the signal to the safety valve to shut off the LDG hydraulic pressure? (Level 2)
How many BTMU does the aircraft have? (Level 2)
The MLG door uplock is: (Level 2)
What is the normal retraction sequence? (Level 3)
Answers: Door open, gear up, door close, cancel gear up signal.
Door open, gear up, door close, maintain gear up signal.
Door open, gear up, door close, cancel door close signal.

Questions.QuestionString: How is inflight braking initiated? (Level 3)
Answers: By setting the landing lever to the UP position.

Questions.QuestionString: When does the BSCU provide anti-skid control? (Level 3)
What is the purpose of the hydraulic fuses? (Level 3)
Answers: To shut off the return lines

Questions.QuestionString: Which hydraulic system powers normal braking? (Level 3)
What are the auto brake arming condition? (B1,B2) (Level 3)
Answers: An AUTO BRK pushbutton pressed in, green pressure and anti-skid powered and no failure in normal braking system.
An AUTO BRK pushbutton pressed in, yellow pressure and anti-skid powered and no failure in normal braking system.
An AUTO BRK pushbutton pressed in, green pressure and anti-skid deactivated and no failure in normal braking system.

Questions.QuestionString: When does the automatic changeover of the LGCIUs in control occur? (B1,B2) (Level 3)
Before the landing gear can be retracted, what must the LGCIU detect? (Level 3)
Can you operate the "nose wheel steering” during take off and landing when the speed above 130 kts? (Level 3)
Answers: It is possible through rudder pedals
It is possible through hand wheels

Questions.QuestionString: When is the anti-skid function inhibited by the BSCU? (Level 3)
Answers: When the auto brake system has failed.

Questions.QuestionString: Which component gives priority to the green hydraulic system during classic system? (Level 3)
Safety valve cutoff hydraulic to landing gear system when speed: (Level 3)
In case of normal braking system failure, how is alternate barking applied? (B1,B2) (Level 3)
Answers: Automatically when the selector valve is de-energized
As soon as the braking pedals are pressed in

Questions.QuestionString: In the A321 enhance (Level 3)
Answers: A/SKID is controlled by BSCU & ABCU.

Questions.QuestionString: In which mode is progressive pressure sent to the brakes 2 seconds after ground spoilers deployment? (Level 3)
Function of the hydraulic fuse, which is fitted in the line to brake unit is: (Level 2)
Answers: To make sure that inadvertent braking action can not happen.
To make sure that no hydraulic pressure from green system can be transferred to yellow system.
To shut off the hydraulic supply to the brake unit case too much fluid flows in to the direction of the brake unit due to line damaged.

Questions.QuestionString: What effect on the slat and flap system will failure of SFCC 2 cause? (Level 2)
Answers: Slat system operates at half speed.
Flap system operates at half speed.
Slat and flap systems operate at half speed.

Questions.QuestionString: When does the UNLK light come on? (Level 3)
Answers: When the gear and the related doors are not locked up.
When the gear is not locked down.
When the gear is not locked in the selected position.

Questions.QuestionString: What happens when the gravity extension crank handle is rotated? (Level 3)
Answers: The cut-out and vent valves operate
The safety and cut-out valves operate
The safety and vent valves operate

Questions.QuestionString: How can the parking brake be hydraulically powered? (Level 3)
Answers: Either by yellow high pressure or by the brake accumulator

Questions.QuestionString: What is the purpose of the by pass valve of the hydraulic steering control unit? (Level 2)
Answers: To interconnect the two chambers of the steering actuator.
To apply hydraulic pressure to the servovalve.
To by pass the servovalve in case of BSCU failure.

Questions.QuestionString: Which component gives priority to the green hydraulic system? (level 2)
Can you operate the Nose Wheel Steering during take off and landing when the speed is above 130 Kts? (Level 3)
Answers: It is possible through rudder pedals
It is possible through hand wheels

Questions.QuestionString: How is the in flight braking initiated? (Level 1)
Answers: By selecting the landing lever to the "UP" position
By the main landing gear door opening

Questions.QuestionString: What are the auto brake arming conditions? (Level 1)
Answers: An auto brake pushbutton pressed in, green pressure and anti-skid powered and no failure in normal braking system.
An auto brake pushbutton pressed in, yellow pressure and anti-skid powered and no failure in normal braking system.
An auto brake pushbutton pressed in, green pressure and anti-skid deactivated and no failure in normal braking system.

Questions.QuestionString: During Landing Gear free fall extension, the cut out vavlve and both vent valves operate to depressurize the hydraulic system if: (Level 3)
Answers: Crank handle moves up to 0.5 turn.
Crank handle moves up to 1,5 turns.
Crank handle moves up to 2.5 turns.

Questions.QuestionString: If normal braking system failure, alternate braking applied:(Level 1)
Answers: Automatically when the selector valve is de-energized
As soon as the braking pedals are pressed in.

Questions.QuestionString: Which computer monitors the aircraft tire pressure and brake temperature:(Level 1)
A changeover between the two BSCU channels takes place:(Level 1)
Answers: when landing gear control lever is set to down
when landing gear control lever is set to up

Questions.QuestionString: Which computer gives the indications on the landing gear wheel page:(Level 1)
Answers: The LGCIU 1(2) on duty, then the other LGCIU 2(1) if LGCIU 1 (2) failed.

Questions.QuestionString: In normal condition, with all hydraulic systems availability and nose wheel steering toggle switch OFF, applying braking system using pedals will operate:(Level 1)
The CLASSIC nose wheel steering and gear/door control system is supplied from:(Level 1)
When is the entire aircraft landing gear hydraulic circuit isolated from the pressure source after retraction:(Level 1)
Answers: as soon as the control lever is moved to neutral
as soon as the airspeed is greater than 260 kts.
by rotating joint for nose gear and by safety valve for main gear upon a certain aircraft speed reached.

Questions.QuestionString: Which statement is correct concerning alternate braking indication?(Level 1)
Answers: The "DECEL" light comes on green when the correct deceleration is reached deceleration is reached
A triple indicator for alternate braking system.
The applied alternate braking pressure to be monitored via lower ECAM wheel page

Questions.QuestionString: Which one controls the aircraft braking and steering system:(Level 1)
Answers: Hand wheel for steering system and BSCU for aircraft braking

Questions.QuestionString: How many air charging valve used to service MLG shock absorber?(Level 1)
Free fall lever movement between 1.9 and 3 turns:(Level 1)
Answers: Gear uplocks are released and the landing gear extends by gravity.
Operted the cut-out valve and both vent valves to depressurize the system

Questions.QuestionString: Which computer monitors the aircraft brake temperature:(Level 1)
